.git/hooks/pre-commit.sample

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/bin/sh
00002 #
00003 # An example hook script to verify what is about to be committed.
00004 # Called by "git commit" with no arguments.  The hook should
00005 # exit with non-zero status after issuing an appropriate message if
00006 # it wants to stop the commit.
00007 #
00008 # To enable this hook, rename this file to "pre-commit".
00009 
00010 if git rev-parse --verify HEAD >/dev/null 2>&1
00011 then
00012     against=HEAD
00013 else
00014     # Initial commit: diff against an empty tree object
00015     against=4b825dc642cb6eb9a060e54bf8d69288fbee4904
00016 fi
00017 
00018 # If you want to allow non-ascii filenames set this variable to true.
00019 allownonascii=$(git config hooks.allownonascii)
00020 
00021 # Cross platform projects tend to avoid non-ascii filenames; prevent
00022 # them from being added to the repository. We exploit the fact that the
00023 # printable range starts at the space character and ends with tilde.
00024 if [ "$allownonascii" != "true" ] &&
00025     # Note that the use of brackets around a tr range is ok here, (it's
00026     # even required, for portability to Solaris 10's /usr/bin/tr), since
00027     # the square bracket bytes happen to fall in the designated range.
00028     test "$(git diff --cached --name-only --diff-filter=A -z $against |
00029       LC_ALL=C tr -d '[ -~]\0')"
00030 then
00031     echo "Error: Attempt to add a non-ascii file name."
00032     echo
00033     echo "This can cause problems if you want to work"
00034     echo "with people on other platforms."
00035     echo
00036     echo "To be portable it is advisable to rename the file ..."
00037     echo
00038     echo "If you know what you are doing you can disable this"
00039     echo "check using:"
00040     echo
00041     echo "  git config hooks.allownonascii true"
00042     echo
00043     exit 1
00044 fi
00045 
00046 exec git diff-index --check --cached $against --
